embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201706141538

6.14.17  3:38 pm   i understand that you don't want searching for better and better sounds all the time to get in your way of just writing and recording, but don't you want to transcend a lot of cultural elements that have no distinct purpose to you that you were born into? like approximating the way notes fit together in harmony by using the equal temperament tuning? i dont mean like retune your keyboards, but when talking about microtonal music, i usually tend to think of tuning chords to the harmonic series, rather than the piano. i just hope you actively do that when you can instead of using an easier way all the time to get more content finished. after all you do seem like quite the creativity purist. hell im sure you've thought about it tho. nevermind. you don't need to respond to this im just rambling cause i get triggered when you say no to microtonal music. ur right, splitting half notes in half again doesn't really make that much sense

     ah, you are suggesting that i pursue the 'perfect' tuning, instead of using equal temperment tuning. this sounds like a righteous idea, but i have to tell you that i embarked on a viscious mission (in about january 2011 i believe) to get to the bottom of this situation. i set out to get a perfect tuning that at least worked in 1 key. after many hours (days? i don't remember) of experimentation, what i found surprised me. you actually can't do it. even to play within 1 key, you need to compromise. let me see if i can explain it: start by tuning a C chord properly (so that the E is a true harmony with C, and the G is a true 5th from C.) So let's get our F, that's gonna be a true 5th down from C, right? now A should be a pure major third above F, for sure. and B should surely be a pure major 3rd above G. now what should D be? you would assume that it would be a pure ninth from C (i.e. the frequency times 9 and then divided back down the octaves) which is good for the G chord also because it will be a 5th away from G. looks great, so now you've got C, D, E, F, G, A, B. but what you find next might come as a shock. D minor sounds like a nightmare. because D to A is supposed to be a 5th and now it is a very very wrong 5th. because you tuned your A to be a harmonically pure major 3rd away from F. no matter how you slice it, you inevitably run into the same argument where a 3rd needs to be a purely harmonic 3rd, but also needs to be a series of 5ths. i juggled the possibilities all around for at least a day, and i was completely stunned to find out that the essence of music, and specifically the way the "secondary" notes (let's say in a major key, the secondary notes are D, F, A, and also G, and the primary notes are C,E,G. that's right, G is both, the universe is a love paradox, get used to it) the secondary notes need equal tempered tuning to work right. there are surely many different ways to look at this and i made up the primary and secondary classifications for this example, but the point is that there will always be overlap. you will never have 2 exclusive sets of notes. it stems from the fact that the D note needs to be able to relate to G, but also needs to relate to the A, but the A also needs to relate to the F, and the F also definitely needs to relate to the C. now you might say "ok, tune them differently depending on what chords you're using." but that really doesn't work right, because music needs all these notes to coexist. you're not going to just expect that Dmin and Fmaj will never need to blend together with the A held over. or that Dmin and Gmaj will never need to blend together with the D held over. At the end of this mind exploding journey, i basically found that it seems to be summed up perfectly in 2 chords. Cmaj, and like any combination of D,F,A, and G perhaps with G in the bass. in that 'secondary' chord, all in one moment, (which is the 'less' stable of the 2 chords when they are used in a musical context) that chord encapsulates the dual nature of the way these harmonies are working. is the F in that chord supposed to relate mainly to the C? or is it supposed to relate to the D in a pure minor third? and similarly, is the D supposed to relate to the G? the answer is, all 3 of these relationships are supposed to hold together. but this is mathematically impossible to happen exactly. so the entire essence of that Dmin, or 5dom7(sus if you like?) whatever, 'secondary' chord, the entire essence of that chord is that it contains different relationships that have to all sound like they work and yet they could never all 3 work exactly. the chord needs compromise in order to work. perhaps that is why it feels like the secondary chord or the 'less stable' or the 'i'm just waiting to go back to C' chord. realizing this changed me, because i was always told that equal tempered tuning was mainly used as a compromise to play in all 12 keys. but what i realized is you actually need it just to play in 1 key. like, just to play a 1 and a 2min. just to play the most basic essence of a key and have it work with itself. it really made me appreciate that 'secondary' chord (Dmin, G, etc) the D to F and the D to G relationship on kind of an earth shattering spiritual level, it's like the damn thing has heartbreak built right in. what you think you are hearing is the d to f relationship and the d to g relationship and the f to c relationthip, etc, all at the same time, when really it could never be, at least not exactly. but it is close enough to feel it. basically ever since this experiment i have had a wildly new appreciation for how and why music works, on an even more 'human' level than i expected. and i never questioned equal tempered tuning again

html:
12.9.24  2:40 pm   could i see the script for Perfect! please?

ok
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/perfect.html
(2 characters sitting cross legged on opposide ends of the small curb island shown here with the patches of brick on either end)
(2 cars are shifting between spaces in a way described)


1. what's going on here?
.. avoidance wars. each driver is trying to avoid eye contact with the other person.
do they know each other?
  nope
do they want to know each other?
no way


(some alternate camera angle of the same thing still going on)




do you think we should introduce them?
........... i think that's a great idea


........... but i think          everyone is scared of
[both] "What Might Happen".

(at this moment, the 2 cars seem to shut down and peter out, slightly coasting a bit further in the direction of their last move)


(1)  ... (slightly perplexed) 'hmh, they got tired out.'
(2)        (eyebrow raise, slightly wearily/warning tone), 'they probably had a Big Day yesterday and the day before and the day before')
1: have you ever had a Big Day?
2:  (pause) ................... my whole Life is big. (quickly looks to the side) 'oh, here's street cleaning'.
(the street cleaning vehicle sort of comes through the parking lot at an angle, and weaves between the two cars that were playing the game)

......... which, makes me immediately want to ask,
[both] "Was the Street Dirty"
2:  (immediately) no i don't think so, (&) i can never seem to remember. (1 nodding) (2 speaking pretty quickly) i try to remind myself to TAKE NOTE of whether or not the street's dirty, BEFORE the street cleaning car comes around and cleans it. ....  but i always forget, and then the car comes, and i'll never know.

1 ...... sounds like you need a way to  predict the past

(they look at each other)
2 (nods) 'yeah'
1: (with 2 nodding along) find out how to predict when the current moment is gonna be the past.
and then check up on certain details because you know you won't be able to access them anymore.
(both immediately get up, and start looking around)
1 (immediately) "is one of these cars yours?"
2. yep. i just bought all of them
1... how'd you do that?
2.... they ahh, .. there was an auction.
1. (blankly ?)
2.   online. i didn't have to go, i just sat here and now i own all these cars. .............. except for         those two.       (pause) ....... those are self owning cars.
1:   ok, well can we drive some of these other ones?
2......... ahhhhh, nope, those are all self driving.

1. ok, well then, ....... can one of them drive us somewhere?
2. Sureware.  ... i mean,   ,,  sure, where?
1.  i dunno, to the moon and back?
2. .... (disappointment voice) oww, i think that might be out of range for some of these cars.
1.how about down the street?

2... (thinkin)...... sure. if you can figure out which way that is.

(some hypnotic shot maybe zooming backwards (split screen or something?) bothways down the street, .. something hypnotic which makes both directions seem equivalent




1. do the cars know?
2.  the cars,.......... (thinks for a moment),.... these cars know everything, which   unfortunately cancels out and, so they know nothing.
1.(they) KNOW nothing?
2 (immediately corrects self) FEEL nothing.
1. (ah.)
2. they know everything. .........             so they don't care.
1. (i see.)
2. ...... so it means don't ask for their opinion.
1. right. so [immediately pulls out some kind of megaphone device, but less annoying. something with like, just some nice delay/reverb on it, and a nice clean shout] WHERE DO YOU WANNA GO?
2. welllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll, let's think about what our options are.
(they both go and sit atop the business names sign)
1. (immediately, a bit soft, confidatory) you know just realized, we could actually go anywhere, and now i'm feeling kind of overwhelmed.
2. (immediately, same tone) i know what you mean. .............. is there anywhere you've been before?
1........ yes,    i've been somewhere before.
2. well can we go There?
1. i don't remember where it was
2. oh.


2.   was it here?
1. yes.
2. oh

2. are we there y-
1 (smile)  Welcome.  yes, we're here.
2. i'm excited about that.
[immediately huge rush of traffic on main road, surrealistically fast, in both directions]

1. where do you think all those people are going?
2. (slow, blank stare forward) .. away. (quickly corrects self, and looks at the cars) no it's ah,
1. (also looking) ....... half of them.
2. yea, ... .....no, it's (they both suddenly realize)
both: "all of them are going away,   half the time"
2. and the other half of the time they're ........   coming back?
1. no.  .. they came back first. .. then went away.
2. .. right.

2. from where?
1. i think it might be a loop... (looking)
2....no, it couldn't be. this road has no curvature whatsoever.
1. yes, but they could be making a series of angular turns.
2. that's right, good point. (show diagram, with vague subconscious allusion to right angles and points, but not too much)


2. (looking) everyone around here seems pretty driven.
1. that's just a sign of the times.  ...... 5 minutes ago, no one was going anywhere.
2. i remember.
1. now all that's changed

2.....  except we're still here.
1. i just noticed that.


2.  how is that possible?




1. ... it must be because of this sturdy commercial signage fixture upon which we are perched
2. ... (smirk) "sit on a sign, ... (looks at camera) feelin fine (looks back at 1)"............. "that's my motto"
1. (stares back at 2).............  "my motto is different than that".
2. "i understand that"

1.(megaphone again) SHALL WE AMOUNT TO SOMETHING
2. well how do you propose we do that?
(the flow of cars slowly but fairly quickly peters out, like when the rain stops pretty quickly.)

1 (looking up)........ (pointing) we could go up.
2. i don't know how to do that.
1. (looking up again)
2. that's the one thing, i've never learned how to do.


2. i can do everything besides that.

1. can you go .... to the side?
2. i'm pretty sure i can
1. but just not up.
2 right,yep. no.
1. (immediately, climbing down) "these places--"  "this has gotta be fictional" (looking at the business names on the sign
(looking around, to the store fronts, comparing to the sign, ... pensive look, they both have)
2..... no, it's real.

(a singular car drives by)

1.   .......... is there any way to test that?
2. ............. try to make up something better.
1. ......................................... honestly, i would have spelled this with more 'R's.  (looking at one of the business names)
2. (immediately reveals another R, of the same font, from pocket or behind back or something) "here"
1. (slaps it onto the sign) (looks at it, ponders it)  .......... (takes it off and hands it back) "nah".......   "i see what you mean."
(they both go into statue mode (like the walking budget got cancelled) and then begin sliding back and forth with hand slider motion on the side walk, not going through each other. ))
1. everything is perfect. [end]

4.9.24  9:13 am   what's the progression of time signatures in the ending?

this
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202208232349

8.23.22  11:49 pm   holy moly bill can i maybe get a road map for the time sigs in your newest song, thanks

       sure. there's probably many ways to do it, but here's how i would do it, if it were written down. tempo = 128.
       4/4 for 4 bar instrumental intro
       "getting ready..." 4/4, 4/4, 2/4
       "weather"... 4/4, 4/4, 2/4, 4/4, 2/4 (*option to blow through in all 4)
       "yes i'd" 4/4, 4/4, 4/4, 2/4, 2/4, 4/4, 2/4 (*that's the way it feels, but nevermind those two 2/4s in a row. that's probably stupid. just call it 4 there)
       "out, i'm not worthy" 4/4 for 8 bars
       "ue, it's not true it's not true that's not true" 4/4 for 6 bars
       "musical music" 4/4 for 4 bars
       "don't really know" 4/4, 5/4, 4/4, 3/4, 4/4, 4/4 (or, if you are playing the cowbell here, perhaps you'd prefer a chart that just keeps it all in 4. vocalist or anyone playing along with the vocal riff would probably prefer to break it up into skips as shown)
       "weep, skip" 4/4 for 4 bars
       "slow it" 5/4, 6/4, 5/4, 4/4 HOLD (fermatta, but the recording specifically adds one additional bar of 5/8)
       "riff" 4/4, 4/4, 4/4, 2/4
       "more riff" 4/4, 4/4, 2/4, 4/4, 2/4 (*or, again, if you prefer you may skip this pair of 2/4s and cancel it out)
       "i'm not worthy" 4/4 for 9 bars
       "true" and vamp. 4/4 + 5/4 alternating until the end

       "more riff" 4/4, 4/4, 2/4, 4/4, 2/4 (*or, again, if you prefer you may skip this pair of 2/4s and cancel it out)
       "i'm not worthy" 4/4 for 9 bars
       "true" and vamp. 4/4 + 5/4 alternating until the end

3.8.22  8:08 pm   In the airport terminal, did you actually heT PORRIDGE FOR THE WRONG AMOUNT OF TIME?

      no, what i did was i embarked into writing a bridge section which i thought took some interesting turns but instead it got me backed into a corner i didn't want to go to and couldn't get out of. so i removed that part, went back to the point before it did that, and then used one of my standard tricks which is: express how i feel about how the writing process is going, in the writing


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202103230444

3.23.21  4:44 am   in your song 'at the airport terminal,' is the line "and i'm eating porridge but i've heated it for the wrong amount of time" an allegory?

     i'm not sure what allegory means, but i think yes

     if yes, what do you actually mean by it? 

     that bridge section was getting ...... lost and useless, and it just wasn't re-connecting back to main section. so i chopped off a few bars and replaced it with the porridge part. which seems to be a metaphor for losing track of the time


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202102170740

2.17.21  7:40 am   what was the inspiration behind "i'm eating porridge but i've heated it for the wrong amount of time"?

     the bridge section was in danger of losing momentum and getting weak and lost. So i did what any responsible adventurer would do. confess my sins and move along

      actually what was the inspiration behind all of "at the airport terminal"?

     the inspiration for the first line and main melody was just based on a warm pleasant feeling of traveling through an airport terminal. Then, each moment after is inspired by the previous moments in the song so far


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202101212215

9.27.22  3:22 am   for the parts in your songs where theres like a little lick between lyrics, are those present in the writing process or do they show up during the production process?

      sometimes yes, sometimes no. i will spot check some songs and tell you which is which:
      in the song "where i've been", after the line "where i was, i'm gone" this riff was NOT in the writing.
      in the song "where i've been", after the line "into another day" this riff was in the writing.
      in the song "the ending", the following lines were in the writing:
           the first 4 bars of instrumental      
           the low piano riff after "still sounds musical"
           the 2nd verse melody (before and after the flagpole part) (same as the first verse)
      in the song "the ending", the following lines were NOT in the writing:
           the low piano riffs halfway through the choruses (after "wanna be" and "rather be")
           the low piano riff going into the final chorus (not worthy)
           the plucked violin riff after "musical music is true"
      in the song "meet me in september", the riff after "celebrate/complicated" was in the writing.       
      in the song "and the day goes on", in the bridge, after "long gone", the riff here was not in the writing, but the chords under it were
      the solo in "airport terminal" (around "night return") is improvised
      the instrumental intro to "slow down" was not in the writing.
      in "christmas isn't real", the low riff leading into "dumptrucks" was not in the writing
      in "movie star", the lick in the midpoint of the 3rd verse (pants, planes, etc) at 2min was not in the writing
      the solo chorus in "la de da" was only in the writing as much as to say it must quote "where did all the good times go" around bar 3-4. the rest being open
      the riff in "hello sexy pants" after "lights go black" was not in the writing
      in "in california", the organ riffs after "arizona", "colorado", and "indiana", were in the writing. however, the horn stabs simultaneous to those riffs were not.
      in "i'm a princess", the chorus riff (during the 8 bars after 'about my world') was in the writing. the solo in the last chorus (the 3 bars after 'friends in need') was not in the writing
